conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the balls and the equilibrium of the system.
The balls are connected by thin light wires.
The tension in the wires is the only force acting on each ball.
The tension in the wire from the A ball to the B ball is T_A.
The tension in the wire from the B ball to the C ball is T_C.
The net force acting on each ball is zero.
The sum of the forces in the x-direction must be zero.
For ball A, the force from the left to the right is T_A cos θ.
For ball B, the force from the left to the right is T_B cos θ.
For ball C, the force from the left to the right is T_C cos θ.
The sum of the forces in the x-direction is T_A cos θ + T_B cos θ + T_C cos θ = 0.
The sum of the forces in the y-direction is T_A sin θ + T_B sin θ + T_C sin θ = 0.
Express T_A + T_B + T_C = 0 from the first equation.
Express T_A + T_B + T_C = 0 from the second equation.
Solve for the ratio of the masses: m_A/m_C = T_A/T_C.
